page.title: 10FARMING..CROP IRRIGATION
page.content: Irrigating crops has many advantages. In 1985 before the watering system at Hilton of Carslogie was complete an unwatered field of potatoes yielded 10 tonnes per acre and the tubers were affected by scab, a symptom of dry soils. A neighbouring field which was irrigated yielded 17 tonnes per acre of quality tubers.Other crops on the farm also benefit with the addition of water,especially vegetables and grass. More farmers in our area may be tempted to invest in borehole water extraction because the River Tay Purification Board is concerned at the unrestricted use of surface stream water for crop spraying. In the near future farmers may be banned from using this surface water and this may encourage more of them to extract supplies from underground sources.
